articles.title: Gastric cancer: Understanding the risks, symptoms and treatment options
articles.description: With two thirds of patients diagnosed at an advanced stage, an oncologist shares how greater awareness of the disease and new treatment options can make a difference.
articles.content: If a patient presents with gastric symptoms, doctors may begin with a blood test to check for anaemia – a possible sign of gastric cancer, said Prof Kong. This is often followed by a gastroscopy, which allows doctors to examine the stomach lining and... [1890 chars]

articles.description: T﻿he company said it had apologised to the couple involved and promised to make changes to its processes.
articles.content:

articles.title: NSW deputy premier Prue Car reveals breast cancer diagnosis and will take time off to ‘fight this’
articles.description: MP says screenings are vital for early detection and encourages women to stay up to date with health checks
articles.content:
The NSW deputy premier and education minister, Prue Car, will take leave after being diagnosed with breast cancer.

articles.content:

articles.title: Strawberry Moon 2025: What Makes This Year's Full Moon So Special And Rare
articles.description: The Strawberry Moon is set to rise on June 10 and reach peak brightness early on June 11. This year, it will appear lower and redder than usual, thanks to a rare lunar standstill, making it one of the most unique and rare full moons in nearly 20 years., US News News - Times Now
articles.content:
Strawberry Moon (Representative Image) Photo : iStock

articles.title: Reading this? Your brain is already deciding when to blink next
articles.description: Spontaneous eye blinks during text reading serve a cognitive role, with rates varying by punctuation and word predictability, according to recent research.
articles.content:
How do you know when to blink? A study shows that blinking does more than keep your eyes moist; your brain is actually timing your blinks around sentences, surprises, and the flow of a story.
